item.title: The Jabra Evolve 75 is a wireless headset with active noise cancellation
item.description: Jabra designed the new Evolve 75 wireless headset specifically for busy, open office environments. It is the first headset to receive Microsoft Skype for Business’ Open Office and Outdoor certifications. Notably, it’s also the first Evolve headset to combine active noise cancellation and Bluetooth capability. Source: Jabra. The Evolve 75 in action in an open office. To expand their Evolve headset range for the modern office worker, Jabra released the wireless Evolve 75.

item.title: Bose's sleepbuds are specifically created to improve our sleep quality by masking noise
item.description: Bose has introduced noise-masking sleepbuds â€” wireless earbuds designed to combat common sleep-disrupting noises with a blend of comfortable design and soothing sounds. Source: Bose. Bose sleepbuds offer noise masking, not noise cancellation. These sleepbuds, the most compact product Bose has developed, come equipped with 10 preloaded “sleeptracks.” These tracks are designed to mimic the frequencies of common noises like snoring, neighbors, dogs, and traffic, effectively masking them with calming audio.

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5513): Installation of Beolover Commander MkII Remote and Internal RIAA Pre-Amp Board
item.description: The owner of the Beogram 4002 (5513) requested the installation of a 4002 Commander remote control and an internal RIAA pre-amplifier module. The Commander enables complete control of the 4002 using an Apple remote, while the RIAA provides a strong output signal, allowing direct connection to modern amplifiers via CD/DVD/AUX inputs. The first image displays the RIAA board and its mounting adapter, which elevates it above the output PCB headers.
